dsm

Class DSM

  • java.lang.Object
    • dsm.DSM

  • public class DSM
extends java.lang.Object
    This class implements numerous distributional semantic models based on information extracted from corpora, and evaluates them on standard datasets.


    Usage:

    java -cp DSM.jar dsm.DSM EvaluationDataset InputData VectorNormalization SimilarityMeasure WeightingScheme minimumWordSimpleFrequency minimumFeatureSimpleFrequency minimumWordFeatureTupleSimpleFrequency filterStopWords MinimumWeight Smooth FeatTransf DimRed

    String EvaluationDataset: the test dataset, on which the DSM is evaluated (EvalDatasetReader). Some datasets are available for multiple languages. The language of the test dataset used depends on the language of the InputData used.
    • MenDev: the development part of the MEN dataset
    • MenDevPart1: the first half of the development part of the MEN dataset
    • MenDevPart2: the second half of the development part of the MEN dataset
    • MenTest: the test part of the MEN dataset
    • MenFull: the full MEN dataset
    • RubensteinGoodenough65: the Rubenstein-Goodenough-65 dataset
    • MillerCharles28: the Miller-Charles-28 dataset
    • WordSim353: the WordSim-353 dataset
    • SimLex999: the SimLex-999 dataset
    • Toefl: the TOEFL dataset
    • ToeflPart1: the first part of the TOEFL dataset
    • ToeflPart2: the second part of the TOEFL dataset
    • Moldovan: the Moldovan dataset

    String InputData: the type of extracted information or word vectors used as input for the DSM. For more info see (ExtractedInfoReader).

    String VectorNormalization: the type of vector normalization used before the comparison of word vectors (VecNorm).
    • NN: no normalization
    • L1: L1 norm
    • L2: L2 norm

    String SimilarityMeasure: the type of vector similarity measure used in the DSM. For more info see (VecSim).

    String WeightingScheme: the type of weighting scheme used in the DSM. For more info see (Weight).

    Integer minimumWordSimpleFrequency: minimum limit on word frequencies (MiscParam)

    Integer minimumFeatureSimpleFrequency: minimum limit on feature frequencies (MiscParam)

    Integer minimumWordFeatureTupleSimpleFrequency: minimum limit on word-feature tuple frequencies (MiscParam)

    Boolean filterStopWords: the option to filter stop-words or not (MiscParam)

    String MinimumWeight: minimum limit on word-feature tuple weights (MiscParam). For more info see the Section 4.2.9 of the dissertation.
    • "null": no limit
    • "Limit" minimumWordFeatureTupleWeightParameter: Limit type of limit, with a Double as the value of the limit
    • "Zero" minimumWordFeatureTupleWeightParameter: Zero type of limit, with a Double as the value of the limit

    String Smooth: the type of smoothing used on the word vectors (Smooth).
    • "NoSmooth": no smoothing
    • "WeightKNS" KNSParameter: Kneser-Ney smoothing on weights, with a Double parameter
    • "FreqKNS" KNSParameter: Kneser-Ney smoothing on raw counts, with a Double parameter
    • "FreqMKNS" KNSParameter1 KNSParameter2 KNSParameter3: Modified Kneser-Ney smoothing on raw counts, with 3 Double parameters
    • "FreqMDKNSPOMD" KNSParameter1 KNSParameter2 KNSParameter3: Multi-D Kneser-Ney Smoothing Preserving the Original Marginal Distributions on raw counts, with 3 Double parameters

    String FeatTransf: the type of feature transformation used. For more info see (FeatTransf).

    String DimRed: the type of dimensionality reduction used on the word vectors. For more info see (DimRed).

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        This function tests my methods on the input word pair similarity or synonym question datasets. First it initializes the parameters from the command-line arguments, and also initializes some other parts. Then it reads in the test dataset and the information extracted from the used corpus. After this, computes the necessary weights for the (word, feature) pairs. Then it computes the semantic similarity of all the word pairs in the selected test dataset. Finally, it evaluates the performance of the method and prints out the results.
        Parameters:
        args - the command-line arguments for the input parameters
